content:
I'm really interested in reading more about women's roles in WWII, so I think I'll start with "The Alice Network" and "The Women in the Castle". I've heard great things about both books, and they seem to offer a nuanced exploration of women's experiences during that time.

I'm open to exploring different eras and settings, but for now, I think I'll focus on WWII. It's a period that fascinates me, and I feel like there's still so much to learn about the experiences of women during that time.

By the way, have you heard about any upcoming book releases that might be of interest to me? I'm always looking for new books to add to my reading list!
